description.narrative:
CNVP har ansökt om Sida-finansiering på 26 miljoner kronor för att genomföra projektet Local Economic Development i Albanien under perioden oktober 2020 – mars 2023. Det övergripande målet med insatsen är att öka den ekonomiska tillväxten på den bergiga albanska landsbygden genom utveckling av marknadssystemet för medicinska och aromatiska växter (MAPs) och andra skogsprodukter genom: i) förbättrad produktivitet av MAPs; ii) hållbara pro-poor affärsmodeller för MAPs marknadsaktörer i den privata sektorn; iii) möjliggöra för miljöpolicyer och regelverk att främja rättvisa och hållbara metoder.
Insatsens totala budget på 26 miljoner kronor kommer att finansieras av Sida.

CNVP has applied for Sida funding of 26 million SEK to implement the project ' Local Economic Development' in Albania during October 2020 - March 2023. The overall goal of the contribution is to enhance economic growth of rural mountainous Albania through the development of the marketing system for Medical Aromatic Plants (MAPs) and other forest produce, to be achieved through: I) Improved MAPs productivity; ii) sustainable pro-poor business models of MAPs private sector market actors; iii) Enabling environment policies and regulations to promote fair and sustainable practices.
The total budget of intervention of 26 Million SEK will be funded by Sida.

The overall objective of the project is to increase the incomes of households in rural Albania by promoting improvements in the efficiency and inclusiveness of the Medical Aromatic Plants (MAPs) and other Non Timber Forest Products (NTFPs) market system. The specific objective is to promote sustainable and resilient business and inclusive access to benefits for MAPs and other NTFP products in rural Albania. This will be achieved by designing and implementing a set of interventions aiming to address the problems and contraits faced by MAPs producers. The project will use the Market System Development (MSD) approach. The expected outcomes of the project are: Outcome 1: Improved MAPs (and other NTFPs) productivity. Outcome 2: MAPs (and other NTFPs) private sector market actors have sustainable pro poor business models. Outcome 3: Enabling environment policies and regulations promote fair and sustainable practices.
